New Adult Nonfiction Books

New Arrivals Added To Our Adult Nonfiction Collection
URL: http://money.mcpl.info/new-arrivals
Updated: 1 day 1 min ago

After Camelot : a personal history of the Kennedy family 1968 to the present by Taraborrelli, J. Randy.

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

In this ambitious and sweeping account, Taraborelli continues the Kennedy family chronicle begun with his bestselling "Jackie, Ethel, Joan" and provides a behind-the-scenes look at the years "after Camelot."

Against wind and tide : letters and journals, 1947-1986 by Lindbergh, Anne Morrow, 1906-2001.

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

A final collection of selected letters and diary entries by the National Aviation Hall of Fame inductee follows her struggles over an unplanned pregnancy, the evolution of "Gift from the Sea," and her views on politics during the Vietnam War.

Ancient Rome by Marcovitz, Hal.

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

Briefly discusses the rise and fall of the Roman Empire.

And then life happens : a memoir by Obama, Auma, 1960-

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

Asylum : Hollywood tales from my great depression -- brain dis-ease, recovery and being my mother's son by Pantoliano, Joe.

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

Most people know Joe Pantoliano from his memorable roles in The Sopranos, The Matrix, The Goonies, Risky Business, Memento, and The Fugitive. But before he became one of Hollywood's most successful character actors, he was "Joey Pants" from Hoboken, the son of a fiercely controlling schizophrenic mother. Growing up, Joe always knew something was different with him, too. "It was as if I was born with a huge hole inside of me," he writes. Not until much later in life was Joe diagnosed with clinica

Bill Veeck : baseball's greatest maverick by Dickson, Paul.

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

Bird sense : what it's like to be a bird by Birkhead, T. R.

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

The candidate : what it takes to win, and hold the White House by Popkin, Samuel L.

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

Champion of freedom : Aung San Suu Kyi by O'Keefe, Sherry.

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

Chronicles the life of the Burmese opposition figure who has spent much of her recent life under house arrest imposed by the country's military junta.

Champion of freedom : Dietrich Bonhoeffer by Martin, Michael, 1948-

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

Chronicles the life of the German pastor who opposed Nazi anti-Christian policies and, after being exposed as a conspirator in the plot to assassinate Hitler, died at the FlossenbuÂ¨rg concentration camp in 1945.

Code to joy : the four-step solution to unlocking your natural state of happiness by Pratt, George J.

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

The complete idiot's guide to couponing by Gordon, Rachel Singer.

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

By combining the wealth of coupons with a few simple changes in the way you shop, you'll quickly see your bills drop while your pantry and other stockpiles grow!

The complete idiot's guide to eating Paleo by Quinn, Neely.

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

Get back to basics with a paleolithic diet! Our hunter-gatherer ancestors didn't load up on nutritionally barren, high-fat, high-calorie, processed foods. They feasted on lean meats and fish, fresh fruit and vegetables, and nutritional nuts and seeds-- and were healthier for it!

The complete idiot's guide to fermenting foods by Harmon, Wardeh.

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

Fermented foods are supercharged with incredible nutrition, unique flavor, and countless health benefits. This guide provides step-by-step instructions for fermenting vegetables and fruits into pickles, krauts, salsas, relishes, and chutneys.

The complete idiot's guide to smoking foods by Reader, Ted.

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

Smoking foods is an art. This in-depth guide gives you everything you need to know to become master of your smoker, from buying the right smoker and accessories, to using marinates, brines, and rubs. Also includes tips on entering a BBQ competition.

The complete idiot's guide to trigonometry by Fotiyeva, Izolda.

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

Provides plain-English explanations of the most challenging aspects of trig, plus numerous practice problems, and their easy-to-follow solutions. This helpful guide is the next best thing to a personal trigonometry tutor!

The conflict : how modern motherhood undermines the status of women by Badinter, Elisabeth.

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

The cure for everything : untangling twisted messages about health, fitness, and happiness by Caulfield, Timothy A., 1963-

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

"With the goal of getting to the truth about our health, this book looks at both what the best available scientific evidences tells us about the role of fitness, diet, genetics and health remedies and the social forces that twist and distort what that evidence actually says"--Provided by publisher.

The decade of the 2000s by Robson, David, 1966-

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am

Presents the political, social, and cultural trends of the first decade of the twenty-first century which included terrorist attacks, the first African American president, financial collapse, and inventions like the iPod and Facebook.

A difficult woman : the challenging life and times of Lillian Hellman by Kessler-Harris, Alice.

Mon, 04/30/2012 - 3:01am
